title: Systematic and axiological capacities in artificial intelligence applied in the public sector
research_description: The paper describes and analyzes AI capabilities in the public sector through a survey conducted with public officials in Mexico. The results classify AI capabilities into systematic and axiological factors, based on public officials' perception.
research_results: AI capabilities in the public sector are classified into systematic factors (monitoring, analyzing, interacting, remembering, anticipating) and axiological factors (acting, feeling, moralizing, creating, deciding).
future_research: Future research could explore the application of these categories to understand the broader implications of AI adoption in other public sectors.
